update.description:
As part of the works to properly implement visibility on gazebo, this first PR tries to handle the embedded opende copy we had under deps/ directory.

As of now, we were generating 4 shared libraries which are not really being used anywhere more than in gazebo_physics_ode. Since they are a fork of the official ode libraries I would prefer no to re-distribute them (libs and headers) if possible.

The approach here is to change them to be static and statically linked them into gazebo_physics_ode and not to install all related headers files. 

After this first step, we will be able to define as ```GAZEBO_VISIBLE``` the functions on ```gazebo/physics/ode``` and all symbols from our ode fork will keep not exported, which I believe is a good thing to do. 

I was able to compile, install and run drcsim on top of these changes.
update.title: Convert opende libraries to be static and not installed (->default)

pull_request.title: Convert opende libraries to be static and not installed (->default)

pullrequest.title: Convert opende libraries to be static and not installed (->default)

content.raw: I was trying to avoid conflicts in the case of someone have installed ode in the system and tries to make use of a program mixing gazebo and some ode features. Symbol collision ending up in weird segfaults (like the one we had with urdfdom and sdformat) is what I was trying to avoid hidden the full copy of our ode library inside gazebo_physics_ode. Maybe have a clear use case (an example mixing gazebo and ode) as example could help us to think in the proper solution.
content.html: I was trying to avoid conflicts in the case of someone have installed ode in the system and tries to make use of a program mixing gazebo and some ode features. Symbol collision ending up in weird segfaults (like the one we had with urdfdom and sdformat) is what I was trying to avoid hidden the full copy of our ode library inside gazebo_physics_ode. Maybe have a clear use case (an example mixing gazebo and ode) as example could help us to think in the proper solution.

content.raw:
A user can get a pointer to the underlying physics engine, and make modifications. This is not heavily used outside of the research community, however I don't want to eliminate the capability.

This is really just a naming issue, correct?
content.html:
A user can get a pointer to the underlying physics engine, and make modifications. This is not heavily used outside of the research community, however I don't want to eliminate the capability.

This is really just a naming issue, correct?

pull_request.title: Convert opende libraries to be static and not installed (->default)

pullrequest.title: Convert opende libraries to be static and not installed (->default)

content.raw:
I was imaging that all that gazebo wants to expose to users is hosted in gazebo_physics_ode interface (library and headers) and if anybody needs to access to other ODE core features, he/she can use the main ode library and headers instead of the gazebo fork. It sounds a bit tricky to me to offer user access to a fork of a library (ode) embedded in other bigger application (gazebo).

If to offer the users the option of accessing to our fork of ode is a must, then you are right.
content.html:
I was imaging that all that gazebo wants to expose to users is hosted in gazebo_physics_ode interface (library and headers) and if anybody needs to access to other ODE core features, he/she can use the main ode library and headers instead of the gazebo fork. It sounds a bit tricky to me to offer user access to a fork of a library (ode) embedded in other bigger application (gazebo).

If to offer the users the option of accessing to our fork of ode is a must, then you are right.

pullrequest.title: Convert opende libraries to be static and not installed (->default)

content.raw: I think someone will have trouble creating a plugin that accesses the ODE core features with this PR. They will need the headers and library to link against.
content.html: I think someone will have trouble creating a plugin that accesses the ODE core features with this PR. They will need the headers and library to link against.
